alert.note: Alert for Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN FALLON COUNTY THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 531 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Baker, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage is possible. Locations impacted include... Baker and Ollie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
